name: Reborn
description: Reborn are individuals who have died yet, somehow, still live. They exhibit various signs of their past deaths or origins, and they seek experiences and answers about their new life. Reborn suffer from discontinuity, often struggling with vague or absent memories of their previous lives. They regularly dwell on the past and occasionally experience visions of what came before.

features.ability_score_increase: Increase one ability score by 2 and increase a different one by 1, or increase three different ability scores by 1. If you are replacing your race with this lineage, replace any Ability Score Increase you previously had with this.
features.size: You are Medium or Small. You choose the size when you gain this lineage.
features.ancestral_legacy: If you replace a race with this lineage, you can keep the following elements of that race: any skill proficiencies you gained from it and any climbing, flying, or swimming speed you gained from it. If you don't keep any of those elements or you choose this lineage at character creation, you gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

advantages: You have advantage on saving throws against disease and being poisoned.
You have advantage on death saving throws.
deathless_nature.resistance: You have resistance to poison damage.
needs: You don’t need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You don’t need to sleep, and magic can’t put you to sleep. You can finish a long rest in 4 hours if you spend those hours in an inactive, motionless state, during which you retain consciousness.

features.knowledge_from_a_past_life: When you make an ability check that uses a skill, you can roll a d6 immediately after seeing the number on the d20 and add the number on the d6 to the check. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
features.languages: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language that you and your DM agree is appropriate for the character. If you are replacing your race with this lineage, you retain any languages you had and gain no new languages.

faded_memories.description: Reborn suffer from some manner of discontinuity, with memories before their death being vague or absent. They may experience moments of recalling past events.

lost_memories.1: You recall a physically painful moment. What mark or scar on your body does it relate to?
lost_memories.2: A memory brings tears to your eyes. Is it a bitter or cheerful memory? Does recalling it make you feel the same way?
lost_memories.3: You recall a childhood memory. What about that event or who you were still influences you?
lost_memories.4: A memory brings with it the voice of someone once close to you. How do they advise you?
lost_memories.5: You recall enjoying something that you can’t stand doing now. What is it? Why don’t you like it now?
lost_memories.6: A memory carries a vivid smell or sensation. What are you going to do to recreate that experience?

reborn_origins.description: Reborn might originate from various circumstances similar to undead or constructs.

origins.1: You were magically resurrected but something went wrong.
origins.2: Stitches bind your body’s mismatched pieces, and your memories come from multiple different lives.
origins.3: After clawing free from your grave, you realized you have no memories except for a single name.
origins.4: You were a necromancer’s undead servant for years. One day, your consciousness returned.
origins.5: You awoke in an abandoned laboratory alongside complex designs for clockwork organs.
origins.6: You were released after being petrified for generations. Your memories have faded, though, and your body isn't what it once was.
origins.7: Your body hosts a possessing spirit that shares its memories and replaces your missing appendages with phantasmal limbs.
origins.8: In public, you pass as an unremarkable individual, but you can feel the itchy straw stuffing inside you.
